Our Services

GED Pretest & Preparation

  • Students will pretest in the four GED subject areas, which include, Language Arts, Science, Math, Social Studies.
  • The GED pretest will pinpoint adult's skill deficiencies.
  • Lessons will be automatically assigned that help guide the student to pass the test
  • Program will take 6-8 weeks of studying depending on availability and commitment.
  • Classes will be held in person in a convenient location for both teachers and students.
  • Lessons are also available online for students to have access 24/7.

GED Testing

  • There are practices and mastery tests available.
  • GED test will have to be scheduled online and taken at one of the GED testing centers
  • Retesting in all subjects will be administered again if the adult does not pass the overall test.

Advice & Assistace

Having a GED opens adults to a lot more opportunites than they had before. Some of which include:

  • College Education: Your eligibility is now open to attend most four-year universities and enjoy the traditional on-campus experience, choose to enroll in online degree programs or attend other community/technical colleges.
  • Most states also have a higher rate of employment for individuals with a GED or high school diploma. Improving chances of obtaining employment in legal proffesions, social service carrers, office and administrative support, and/or sales.
  • For those seeking to serve, joining the military is a competitive process but not having a high school diploma will be a disadvantage. Acquiring a GED solves that problem and opens eligibility to different military branches.
  • DTA will also be helping individuals file and meet job applications/requirements.
  • Ensuring they have competent resumes and cover letters for future applications.
  • Partnering with other texas workforce associations and coaches that can provide the right resources for adults to meet their goals.
